gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਦਰਸ ਲਿਵ ਦੇਖੈ ਅੳੁ ਦਿਖਾਵੈ ਸੋੲੀ ਸਰਬ ਦਰਸ ੲੇਕ ਦਰਸ ਕੈ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Drisati Daras Liv Daykhai Au Dikhaavai Soee , Sarab Daras Ayk Daras Kai Jaaneeai ?
translation: An obedient disciple of the Guru who has focused his vision in the glimpse of the True Guru, he observes the impermeable Lord everywhere and every place. He makes others see Him too. He regards and understands that all philosophies are present in His sigh

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਕਹਤ ਸੁਨਤ ਸੋੲੀ ਸਰਬ ਸਬਦ ੲੇਕ ਸਬਦ ਕੈ ਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Kahat Sounat Soee , Sarab Sabad Ayk Sabad Kai Maaneeai ?
translation: When a Guru-oriented person acquires the teachings of the True Guru, his mind gets absorbed in the practicing of Lord's Naam Simran. He then speaks and hears the words of the True Guru deep in his soul. He regards all singing modes engrossed in the melody

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਨ ਕਰਨ ਕਰਤਗਿ ਸਰਬਗਿ ਸੋੲੀ ਕਰਮ ਕ੍ਰਤੂਤਿ ਕਰਤਾਰੁ ਪਹਿਚਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Kaaran Karan Karatagi Sarabagi Soee , Karam Kratooti Karataaru Pahichaaneeai ?
translation: In this state of immersion in the elixir of Naam, a Guru oriented slave recognises the cause of all causes, the knower of all deeds and capable of knowing all; who is the doer of all the deeds-the Doer and Creator,

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਅਨੇਕ ਮੇਕ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਟੇਕ ੲੇਕੈ ੳੁਰਿ ਅਾਨੀਅੈ ||੩੦੧||
transliteration: Satigur Giaan Dhiaanu Ayk Hee Anayk Mayka , Braham Bibayk Tayk Aykai Uri Aaneeai ?301?
translation: And thus a Guru-conscious person becomes aware of One God through the knowledge blessed by the True Guru and perpetual contemplation of Him, Such a person leans on none else for support except One All-pervading Lord, (301)
